citation_title: Measuring Substitution Patterns in Diﬀerentiated-Products Industries
topics:
Econometrics

Estimation Methods

Industrial Organization

Market Structure and Firm Performance
abstract: We study the estimation of substitution patterns within the discrete choice framework developed by Berry (1994) and Berry, Levinsohn, and Pakes (1995). Our objective is to demonstrate the consequences of using weak instruments in this non-linear GMM context, and propose a new class of instruments that are designed to avoid weak IV and can be used to estimate a large family of models with aggregate data. We argue that strong instruments should reﬂect the (exogenous) degree of diﬀerentiation of each product in a market (Diﬀerentiation IVs), and provide a series of examples to illustrate the performance of simple instrument functions.
